title: 104_s1620
content: The "Environmental Dredge Disposal Act of 1996" may be cited as the Act. It pertains to dredged material disposal facilities. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 amends Section 101 to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities associated with Federal navigation projects. This includes upland, aquatic, and confined aquatic disposal facilities for harbors and inland harbors. The Act limits the Federal share of costs for constructing these facilities. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 amends Section 101 to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities for Federal navigation projects. The Act limits the Federal share of costs for constructing these facilities to $25,000,000 per fiscal year. Eligible operation and maintenance costs are covered by funds from the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 amends Section 101 to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities for Federal navigation projects. Eligible operation and maintenance costs shall include the Federal share of constructing and operating dredged material disposal facilities, environmental dredging and disposal facilities for contaminated sediments, and dredging costs for Federal navigation channels. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 includes provisions for mitigating environmental impacts from Federal dredging activities, managing contaminated sediments, and providing preference to port areas with harbor maintenance fees exceeding Federal expenditures. This subsection applies to the construction of dredged material disposal facilities. The subsection applies to contracts for construction of dredged material disposal facilities that have not been awarded before the enactment date. Existing cooperative agreements between the Secretary and non-Federal interests will be amended to conform to this subsection within 30 days unless requested otherwise. The subsection applies to contracts for construction of dredged material disposal facilities not yet awarded. Existing cooperative agreements will be amended to comply within 30 days, with no increase in non-Federal costs for disposal facilities.
